The ratio of the partial pressure of water vapor to the equilibrium vapor pressure of water at a given temperature, unitless.
The ratio of the mass of water vapor to the total mass of moist air.
Depth of water in a column of the atmosphere, if all the water in that column were precipitated as rain.
Direction of origin of wind. The wind azimuth convention is defined as degrees east of north (e.g. North=0, South=180, East=90, West=270).

Diffuse horizontal irradiance.
Direct normal irradiance; irradiance taken on a plane normal to direction of the sun.
Direct normal irradiance at the top of the atmosphere; dni if the atmosphere did not exist. Also sometimes called extraterrestrial irradiance.
Irradiance reaching the module's cells, i.e., in the plane of array, reduced by soiling and reflections, adjusted for spectrum.
Global horizontal irradiance.
Global horizontal irradiance at the top of the atmosphere; ghi as if the atmosphere did not exist.
Plane-of-array irradiance if the atmosphere did not exist.
Total diffuse irradiation in plane. sum of ground and sky diffuse.
Direct/beam irradiation in plane.
Global irradiation in plane. sum of diffuse and beam projection.
In plane ground reflected irradiation
Diffuse irradiation in plane from scattered light in the atmosphere (without ground reflected irradiation)
Horizontal clearness index, kTh = ghi/ghi_toa
Normal clearness index, kTn = dni/dni_toa
Fraction of irradiance in beam component, beam_fraction = 1 - poa_diffuse/poa
Fraction of irradiance in diffuse component, beam_fraction = poa_diffuse/poa
Ground reflectance between 0 and 1.
Elevation of system above sea level.
Latitude between -90 and 90 degrees. Positive north of the equator.
Longitude between -180 to 180 degrees. Positive east of the meridian.
Atmospheric pressure at ground level.
timezone
Temperature coefficient of current at maximum power point and reference conditions.
The temperature coefficient of short-circuit current at reference conditions.
alpha_isc/isc_ref. The temperature coefficient of short-circuit current at reference conditions divided by the short-circuit current at reference conditions.

Energy bandgap at reference temperature. 1.121 eV for crystalline silicon. EgRef must be >0. For parameters from the SAM CEC module database, EgRef=1.121 is implicit for all cell types in the parameter estimation algorithm used by NREL.
The temperature dependence of the energy bandgap at reference conditions in units of 1/K.
Temperature coefficient of voltage at maximum power point and reference conditions.
Temperature coefficient of open-circuit voltage at reference conditions.
beta_voc/voc_ref. Temperature coefficient of open-circuit voltage at reference conditions divided by the open-circuit voltage at reference conditions.
Number of cells in series in a PV module.
Diode ideality factor.
Fill factor of the PV pmp/(voc*isc)
Temperature coefficient of power at maximum power point and reference conditions.
Current at maximum power point at reference conditions.
Reference irradiance. Typical value is 1000 W/m^2.
Short circuit current at reference conditions.
Module aperture area. The area inside the frame for a rectangular module.
Total area of cells in a module.
External dimensions of a module.
The product of the usual diode ideality factor (n, unitless), number of cells in series (Ns), and cell thermal voltage.
The product of the usual diode ideality factor (n, unitless), number of cells in series (Ns), and cell thermal voltage at reference conditions.
Nominal operating cell temperature.
Photo-generated current.
Photocurrent at reference conditions.

Series resistance at reference conditions.

The dark or diode reverse saturation current at reference conditions.
Reference temperature. Typical value is 25 °C.
Voltage at maximum power point at reference conditions.
Open circuit voltage at reference conditions.
Thermal voltage per cell, equal to k_B*T/q where k_B is the boltzman constant (in J/K), T is the temperature (in Kelvin) and q is the electron charge (in Coulombs).
Quantity relating to a number of PV strings.
Quantity relating to a single PV cell
Quantity integrated over a specific length of time, usually the full lifetime of the system.
Quantity integrated over a specific length of time, usually a shorter timespan e.g. day or hour.
Quautity relating to an inverter.
Parameter measured from field data, e.g. voc_meas
Quantity relating to a single PV module
Normalized quantity
Parameter on the datasheet or as-built.
Parameter predicted from a model, e.g. voc_sim
Quantity relating to a string of PV modules.
Angle between direct beam component and surface normal, between 0 and 90.
Height above ground of the bottom edge of the module for a fixed tilt system.
Azimuth of axis of rotation for a single-axis tracking system (e.g. North=0, South=180, East=90, West=270).
Height above ground of the axis of rotation for a single axis tracker.
Orientation of axis of rotation for a single-axis tracking system relative to horizontal. 0 = horizontal.
Date and time of measurement interval

A value denoting the ground coverage ratio of a tracker system which utilizes backtracking; i.e. the ratio between the PV array surface area to total ground area. A tracker system with modules 2 meters wide, centered on the tracking axis, with 6 meters between the tracking axes has a gcr of 2/6=0.333. If gcr is not provided, a gcr of 2/7 is default. gcr must be <=1.
Number of modules in series in each string.
Number of parallel strings in an array of modules.
The ratio of power produced by a PV cell with a particular spectral distribution of light divided by the power produced by a reference spectrum.
Surface azimuth angles. The azimuth convention is defined as degrees east of north (e.g. North=0, South=180, East=90, West=270)
Surface tilt angle. The tilt angle is defined as degrees from horizontal (e.g. surface facing up = 0, surface facing horizon = 90)
ambient dry bulb temperature.
Temperature of the cell.
temperature of the module.
Tracker type, can be 'fixed', 'single-axis' or 'two-axis'.
Refraction-corrected solar elevation angle.
Refraction-corrected solar zenith angle.
Azimuth angle of the sun in degrees East of North
Elevation angle of the sun.
Zenith angle of the sun.
